author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chennai witnessed an absorption of 5.3 million square feet of office space in 2015 and this is bound to increase this year too, said Ajit Kumar Chordia, president of Confederation of Real Estate Associations of India, Chennai, on Monday.

He said last year’s figure was the highest since 2007, the year which saw a record absorption of more than 7 million square feet of office space. The annual Fairpro property exhibition, the three-day event will begin at Chennai Trade Centre on Friday. Mr. Chordia said that the building industry had been urging the State government to bring down the guideline value of property and they were hopeful of a positive development on this front soon, he added. Mohammed Ali, convenor Fairpro, said the highlight of this year’s event would be a ‘no pre-EMI’ offer. Investors who book ready-to-move-in homes need not pay the EMI for one year.

He said 20,790 people visited Fairpro in 2015 and bookings were made for 276 properties worth Rs. 302 crore. This year, there will be over 300 projects on display and added that an iPhone 6 will be given along with every booking. Actor Suhasini Maniratnam was brand ambassador for the event.
title: Fairpro begins on Friday
